TopicTitle: TS 25 stack separatron doesn't split craft on Clamp-o-tron Sr.

Articles.Content:
Hello,

I think I found a bug where if you place TS 25 separatron on a docking port, the separatron does not stage correctly: it "sticks" to one side of the craft, rather than spliting it completely into two separate parts (where separatron wouldnt touch either one). In a way, it works as a regular stack decoupler. You also cannot decouple it via part manager when clicking on docking port, there is no option to "decouple" the said separatron that is stuck.

  • KSP Version
    • 0.1.1.0.21572
  • Operating System and version
    • Windows 10
  • CPU and GPU models, any other system information which could be relevant
    • AMD Ryzen 5 5600X, Nvidia 1080Ti, 16GB RAM @3600MHz. Game installed on M.2 SSD
  • Description of the bug.  
    • TS 25 stack separatron (not decoupler!) does not split the craft as intended when its placed on the Clamp-o-tron Sr.
      • Expected Behavior
        • After pressing stage button, I expect seperatron to be completely separated from two parts that are now split (neither part would be attached to separatron)
      • Observed Behavior
        • After staging, the separatron sticks to "lower" craft as a regular stack decoupler would.
  • Steps to Replicate
    • Add a docking port, then separatron and another docking port (both docking ports facing each other as if you wanted to dock them) in that order.
  • Fixes / Workarounds (if known..)
    • Don't know any workaround yet...
  • A list of ALL mods.  If the list is long, please consider using a spoiler window.
    • No mods, game is stock.
  • Other Notes / Screenshots / Log Files (if possible..)
    • Video 1
    • Video 2

EDIT: Video 3 and Video 4. It appears that smaller separatron does not have the same issue, it competely disconnects from both docking ports.

EDIT 2: I meant stack separator instead of separatron (which is that small solid rocket engine)

Edited March 21, 2023 by paulysch
